Comments_List: A very broad understanding of the spatial consequences (and non-spatial theory) behind migration.
Complicating my view of the world and trying to create a project in which there are no contradictions

Very self-driven, which was both a strength and a weakness. The direction of the class was sometimes hard to pinpoint, particularly once we ended the reading-based class schedule. Sometimes we spent so much time reading quotes that we didn't get to robustly discuss.
Need more specific instructions highly reliant on student development
Yes, as a project-based class that enables a very broad field of research. Not for everyone, but great for the people it is for.
I would not. Class was not well organized no one knew what the point of everything really was
